author: sky.cactus
content: Is anyone aware of anyone working on building a library (and ideally an EVM verifier) that can generate a proof of the contents of a given IPFS hash?

author: jsign
content:
Some years ago I wrote https://github.com/jsign/go-unixfs-proof [UnixFS is a particular format that IPFS uses for storing files/folders] [A "weekend" project...]
But "IPFS hash" is a bit of a black box, since in cidsv1 you can have many data-chunking, hash functions, node fanout, tree layout, and similar tweaks... so probably it should be something "nice" to have something like that viable.
I know some people from protocol labs which might have a true answer to your question, if you want I can connect you with them.

author: sky.cactus
content: I am OK with being limited to simple files with a particular CID version and such.

author: sky.cactus
content: Is the proof verifiable on Ethereum (not using a ZK system that is prohibitively expensive for Ethereum)?

author: jsign
content: I wonder if having proofs for data in a Cid could have good answers today after all the Filecoin work.

author: jsign
content: Never measured the size of the proofs, but I expect them to be quite big since each node in the tree i think was biggish.

author: sky.cactus
content: Is the number of nodes in the tree a function of the size of the file you are proving the hash for?
